intro: Dicalix ernestii, commonly known as the Ernest's dicalix, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is known for its vibrant pink to purple blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Dicalix ernestii is considered a species of conservation concern.
